references.paper_title: Probabilistic Graphical Models: Principles and Techniques
references.reason: This book provides a comprehensive overview of probabilistic graphical models, which are fundamental to the paper's theoretical framework.
This book is a seminal work on causality and its relation to graphical models, highly relevant to the paper's focus on causal discovery.

references.paper_title: A factorization criterion for acyclic directed mixed graphs
references.reason: This paper introduces a key factorization criterion for acyclic directed mixed graphs, which are crucial for the paper's likelihood function derivation.
This paper introduces ancestral graph Markov models, the central class of graphical models considered in this work.

references.paper_title: Generating Markov equivalent maximal ancestral graphs by single edge replacement
references.reason: This paper addresses the problem of Markov equivalence in ancestral graphs, an issue relevant to the paper's search-and-score algorithm.
